competitive_intel:
## Available Competitive Intelligence

- Competition description: `../research/description.md`
- 5 top kernel notebooks in `../research/kernels/`

data_findings.finding: This is a 2D packing optimization problem: fit N Christmas trees (N=1 to 200) into smallest square bounding box. Score = sum of (side^2 / N) for all N. Target: 68.919154, best achieved: 70.659437. Gap: 1.74 points (2.5%).

Key approaches from kernels: 1) bbox3 C++ binary with SA (simulated annealing), 2) tree_packer_v21 with SA + swap moves + multi-start, 3) Backward propagation (BP) - use N-tree config to improve N-1 by removing trees, 4) fix_direction - rotate entire config to minimize bounding box

tree_packer_v21.cpp key features: squeeze (scale towards center), compaction (move trees towards center), local search (8-directional moves + rotations), SA with temperature schedule, swap moves between trees, multi-angle restarts. Uses long double precision and OpenMP parallelization.

Discussion insights: 1) Asymmetric solutions outperform symmetric for winning, 2) Tessellations/lattice packing for large N, 3) Small N (1-20) have lowest efficiency and most room for improvement, 4) N=1 contributes 0.66 to score (highest single contribution)

bbox3.cpp advanced features: Complex number vector coordination, fluid dynamics simulation, hinge pivot moves, density gradient flow, global boundary tension, aggressive overlap repair with separation vectors (MTV approximation). Uses OpenMP parallelization.
Overlap repair strategy: When overlaps detected after optimization, replace invalid N configurations with known-good configurations from donor file. Use STRtree for efficient overlap detection.
